text:
Gary and Julia were trying to figure out how much water is used per person each day. They found information from a recent study.

  • Approximately 4.10 • 1011 gallons of water is used each day in the United States.
  • There are approximately 330,000,000 people in the United States.

To find the answer, they use the expression (4.10 x 1011) ÷ (330,000,000). They have different methods for carrying out the calculations.

Which of these methods makes sense to you? What other method could you use?

What percent of the water used in the United States each day went to each of the following?

Irrigation (1.28 • 1011 gallons of water per day)

Livestock (2.14 • 109gallons of water per day)

z
